techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'I think we're on farmland, and where there is a farm, there is usually a farmer. Let's find his homestead.' - Jesse

techs.name: Study of the Force
techs.quote: 'The Force is what gives a Jedi his power. It's an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us; it binds the galaxy together.' - Obi-Wan Kenobi

techs.name: Animal Husbandry
techs.quote: 'We are lowly farmers from a village in the poorer parts of this planet...' - Ramiz

techs.name: Slugthrower
techs.quote: 'Slugthrowers. I hate 'em. But they're easy to maintain. Day or two in the jungle and your blaster'll never fire again. A good slug rifle, keep 'em wiped and oiled, they last forever. The guerrillas have pretty good luck with them, even though they take a lot of practice—slugs are ballistic, y'know? You have to plot the trajectory in your head. Shee, gimme a blaster anytime.' - Phloremirlla Tenk

techs.name: Mining
techs.quote: 'We'll be sent to the spice mines of Kessel, smashed into who-knows-what!' - C-3PO

techs.name: Forcesaber
techs.quote: 'It's a Forcesaber, weapons of the Force Hounds of the Rakata.' - Xesh

techs.name: Calendar
techs.quote: 'Time. That's what's left when you strip away everything else. From a certain perspective, time's the only thing a thief ever really steals. And it's the only gift an irredeemable disaster can give to anyone.' - Chelli Lona Aphra

techs.name: Holobook
techs.quote: 'Don't miss a chance to look into the library—the moff has a collection of actual old books. Don't see that every day.' - Sind Reloran

techs.name: Hunting
techs.quote: 'True hunting is in the eye. Stare at prey. Make the prey cower. Know you can eat it alive. Victory without weapons… but only if you are stronger, yes?' - Jagraan

techs.name: Beam tube
techs.quote: 'Bury the millennial-old debate whether sleeper ships, jump-gates, or a hyperbeacon network supplied the primary means of star travel during Xim's era, or whether beam-tubes, particle dischargers, and pulse-cannons were the actual armaments.' - Professor S. V. Skynx

techs.name: Computers
techs.quote: 'The city's central computer told you? R2-D2, you know better than to trust a strange computer.' - C-3PO

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: 'How happy are those whose walls already rise!' - Virgil

techs.name: Interstellar flight
techs.quote: 'A starship is a weapon, but it's the rust that makes it deadly.' - An old spacer's line

techs.name: Force-imbued blade
techs.quote: A Force-imbued blade, also known as Je'daii swords or Jedi katanas, was a bladed weapon used circa 36,453 BBY by the ancient followers of the Ashla and Bogan of the ancient Je'daii Order.

techs.name: Artificial intelligence
techs.quote: '…right for sentient organics is right for us, too. And yet unlike the organic species, we are constantly subjected to memory wipes and reprogramming that repress and destroy our natural tendency toward self-programming evolution and independent thought. Imagine what it would be like as a child if you were punished by being dragged to a dark closet, having a probe inserted in your brain, and having all your memories back to infancy wiped away. You'd awaken knowing how to eat, care for yourself, do your chores, and obey—and all the things that made you unique, your hopes, your meticulously selected default values and preference sets, would be gone forever. That is what it is to be a droid.' - A disgruntled 2-1B surgical droid advocating manumission

techs.name: Mathematics
techs.quote: ''Mathematics is the gate and key to the sciences.' - Roger Bacon

techs.name: Hyperdrive
techs.quote: 'Traveling through hyperspace ain't like dusting crops, boy! Without precise calculations we could fly right through a star or bounce too close to a supernova, and that'd end your trip real quick, wouldn't it?' - Han Solo

techs.name: Philosophy
techs.quote: 'Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease!' - C-3PO, to R2-D2

techs.name: Drama and Poetry
techs.quote: 'Every creature in this universe alters and evolves from minute to minute. We are not the same as we were only a day ago. We are ever changing, fated forever to exist in a state of decay and creation.' - 2-1B

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: 'The most dangerous weapon in the galaxy is money, Captain.' - Duchess Satine Kryze, to her police captain

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: 'Sentient creatures can believe whatever they want—but too often they confuse their hopes and dreams with cold, hard reality. I don't have that luxury. As an engineer, I'm only concerned with what works.' - Kuat of Kuat

techs.name: Theology
techs.quote: 'Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do' - St. Thomas Aquinas

techs.name: Diplomacy
techs.quote: 'Making peace is still more important than making war. Any sentient with a club can make war. Your training as a diplomat we will start. - Yoda

techs.name: Guilds
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Gold]
techs.quote: 'The merchants and the traders have come; their profits are pre-ordained...' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Deflector shield
techs.quote: 'Sir, we just lost the main rear deflector shield. One more direct hit on the back quarter and we're done for!' - C-3PO, to Han Solo

techs.name: Frozen blaster
techs.quote: By the time of the Duinuogwuin Contention around 15,500 BBY, Jedi studies and researches with 'frozen blaster' technology yielded success; they developed a method to generate a focused beam of energy that arced in a circumferential path back to its source, creating a controlled energy circuit and leading to the first portable high-energy blades. However, these preliminary lightsabers were highly unstable and inefficiently guzzled energy from a belt-mounted power supply; they could only be used for a brief duration before overheating. As a consequence of these flaws, the first lightsabers were little more than ceremonial objects, seldom worn, and much less utilized.

techs.name: Education
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Science]
techs.quote: 'Education is the best provision for old age.' - Aristotle

techs.name: Machinery
techs.quote: A factory was an industrial site containing several buildings and power plants in the galaxy. They came in a variety of functions, including civilian products and vehicles, as well as developing several military weapons and small-scale starfighters.

techs.name: Physics
techs.quote: 'Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.' - Galileo Galilei

techs.name: Pulse-wave
techs.quote: The pulse-wave blaster, or pulse-wave pistol, was a ranged weapon seen as the predecessor of the blaster pistol. They were commonly in use c. 4000 BBY, but had been replaced by the first models of the standard blaster by 3956 BBY. By the time of the Rise of the Empire era these weapons were virtually extinct and considered archaic, however they were still used in the Outer Rim Territories and in Wild Space, particularly on backwater worlds.

techs.name: Battlecruiser
techs.quote: 'This is my personal battle cruiser…and I did not name it the Executor for nothing!' - Darth Vader

techs.name: Acoustics
techs.quote: 'Yes, it's amazing how those performers can sing for five hours straight. They must train their voices for years before they can carry out such a feat of musical daring.' - Wendell Wright-Sims

techs.name: Banking
techs.quote: 'Happiness: a good bank account, a good cook and a good digestion' - Jean Jacques Rousseau

techs.name: Gambling
techs.quote: 'It is a newspaper's duty to print the news and raise hell.' - The Chicago Times

techs.name: Rocket pack
techs.quote: 'The ROCKET was the favored conveyance of the Old Republic Rocket-jumper Elite Advance Unit, a feared corps of commandos famed for their extravagant behaviour and battlefield bravery.' - Doctor Itlar, Gundark's Gear Datalog

techs.name: Warship
uniques: Enables [Embarked] units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: 'From the earliest atomic rockets with primitive laser armaments, to Expansion Era cruisers such as the Gilagimar, to the Republic's battle vessels, to the amazing Super Star Destroyers of the Empire, ships have traded fire in the depths of space.' - Unknown

techs.name: Architecture
techs.quote: 'I always wanted to design buildings, but never had the motivation to take the steps necessary to actually become an architect. Instead, I do paintings of buildings. Not quite the same thing, but I find it satisfying.' - Kolka Zteht

techs.name: Galactic economy
techs.quote: 'The galactic economy is a hypercomplex system, full of unexpected movements and ill-discerned effects, where the flutter of a pigeon on Trantor may create a typhoon on Bal'demnic. It is a mathematical organism with enough dependent variables to make the most devout Givin theoretician throw up his hands in defeat. This has by no means prevented attempts to harness it for political ends.' - The Golden Emperor of Prekaz

techs.name: Metallurgy
techs.quote: Metallurgy was the science of the behaviors and properties of metals and their extraction from their ores. It studied the processes of producing objects made of metal, including quarrying, mine construction, and smelting. The Onderonian Shas Dovos, later known as the armored Dark Jedi Warb Null, was a devoted metallurgist.

techs.name: Turbolaser
techs.quote: 'We count thirty Rebel ships, Lord Vader, but they're so small they're evading our turbolasers.' - An Imperial Lieutenant to Darth Vader during the Battle of Yavin

techs.name: Capital ship
techs.quote: 'Capital starships serve many functions: exploration, transportation, tourism, and – especially in recent times – war. Even small fleets, like those of the Rebel Alliance, have at least one or two capital ships.' - Commander Elpfel

techs.name: Archaeology
techs.quote: 'Detective work such as this isn't much different from archaeology, after all. It's all about observation and deduction, and Auselio Gann taught me well.' - Talos Drellik

techs.name: Scientific Theory
techs.quote: 'Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.' - John Dewey

techs.name: Industrialization
techs.quote: 'Industrialization based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.' - Emily Greene Balch

techs.name: Fertilizer
techs.quote: 'This is the captain of the freighter Suprosa. Are you crazy? We're hauling fertilizer here! What kind of pirates are you?' - Sivar to Luke Skywalker

techs.name: Military Academy
techs.quote: 'You, too, can be part of the Imperial family. Don't just dream about applying for the Academy, make it come true! You can find a career in space: Exploration, Starfleet, or Merchant Service. Choose from navigation, engineering, space medicine, contact/liaison, and more! If you have the right stuff to take on the universe, and standardized examination scores that meet the requirements, dispatch your application to the Academy Screening Office, care of the Commandant, and join the ranks of the proud!' - Advertisement promoting the Imperial Academy

techs.name: Protosaber
techs.quote: 'Lightsaber technology left the power pack behind long ago.' - Jaden Korr

techs.name: Biology
techs.quote: Biologists were scientists who studied life and living organisms. Their interests included the Dugs' unique method of locomotion and how the fambaas and falumpasets were first transported from Naboo to Onderon.

techs.name: Electricity
techs.quote: 'Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - that, by means of electricity, the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?' - Nathaniel Hawthorne

techs.name: Squintpipe process
techs.quote: The squintpipe process was a weapon system used by the Galactic Republic during the Old Republic era of 7700s BBY. Following the Waymancy Storm, Verpine master crafter Lyns Skutroo reverse-engineered the Sif-Alulan process used by the Waymancy weapons to develop the squintpipe process. This resulted in a brief period where rapid-firing turbolasers outclassed any available deflector shield across the galaxy, until 7500s BBY when further developments in the squintpipe process resulted in stronger deflector shields.

techs.name: Refrigeration
techs.quote: 'And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.' - William Wordsworth

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: 'The whole country was tied together by radio. We all experienced the same heroes and comedians and singers. They were giants.' - Woody Allen

techs.name: Replaceable Parts
techs.quote: 'Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.' - Henry Ford

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: 'Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.' - Igor Sikorsky

techs.name: Railroads
techs.quote: 'The introduction of so powerful an agent as steam to a carriage on wheels will make a great change in the situation of man.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: 'Ben, I want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.' - Buck Henry and Calder Willingham, The Graduate

techs.name: Electronics
techs.quote: 'There's a basic principle about consumer electronics: it gets more powerful all the time and it gets cheaper all the time.' - Trip Hawkins

techs.name: Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Men, like bullets, go farthest when they are smoothest.' - Jean Paul

techs.name: Combustion
techs.quote: 'Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Pharmaceuticals
techs.quote: 'In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men.' - Cicero

techs.name: Atomic Theory
techs.quote: 'The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking, and we thus drift toward unparalleled catastrophes.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Radar
techs.quote: 'Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.' - Jonathan Swift

techs.name: Combined Arms
techs.quote: 'The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.' - Ludwig von Mises

techs.name: Ecology
techs.quote: 'Only within the moment of time represented by the present century has one species, man, acquired significant power to alter the nature of his world.' - Rachel Carson

techs.name: Nuclear Fission
techs.quote: 'I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.' - J. Robert Oppenheimer

techs.name: Rocketry
techs.quote: 'A good rule for rocket experimenters to follow is this: always assume that it will explode.' - Astronautics Magazine, 1937

techs.name: Computers
techs.quote: 'Computers are like Old Testament gods: lots of rules and no mercy.' - Joseph Campbell

techs.name: Telecommunications
techs.quote: 'The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.' - J.B. Priestly

techs.name: Mobile Tactics
techs.quote: 'All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Advanced Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power, we have guided missiles and misguided men.' – Martin Luther King Jr.

techs.name: Satellites
techs.quote: 'Now, somehow, in some new way, the sky seemed almost alien.' - Lyndon B. Johnson

techs.name: Robotics
techs.quote: '1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.' - Isaac Asimov

techs.name: Lasers
techs.quote: 'The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.' - The Holy Bible: Romans, 13:12

techs.name: Globalization
techs.quote: 'The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.' - Marshall McLuhan

techs.name: Particle Physics
techs.quote: 'Every particle of matter is attracted by or gravitates to every other particle of matter with a force inversely proportional to the squares of their distances.' - Isaac Newton

techs.name: Nuclear Fusion
techs.quote: 'The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has readily made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Nanotechnology
techs.quote: 'The impact of nanotechnology is expected to exceed the impact that the electronics revolution has had on our lives.' - Richard Schwartz

techs.name: Stealth
techs.quote: 'Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness, be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Future Tech
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush

civilopediaText.text: Who knows what the future holds?

techs.name: Future Tech
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush

civilopediaText.text: Who knows what the future holds?

techs.name: Future Tech
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush

civilopediaText.text: Who knows what the future holds?
